author: NewsHound Ellen
title: Swalwell: Trump ‘A Serial Loser’ Ever Since 2016 Election | Crooks and Liars
text: CNN anchor Jim Acosta continued to put the spotlight on convicted felon Donald Trump’s violent rhetoric. On Wednesday, [Acosta suggested](https://crooksandliars.com/2024/06/trump-fundraiser-headline-haul-out) we’ve become too numb to it when he noted that nobody else was making a big deal out of Trump’s fundraising email with a giant, highlighted headline, ‘HAUL OUT THE GUILLOTINE!” On Thursday, Acosta asked Democratic Congressman Eric Swalwell for his response. “Well, as someone who's had a lot of those death threats aimed at me and at my colleagues, we're not going to be intimidated,” Swalwell first replied. “But we do prefer voting over violence.” Swalwell argued Trump’s violent rhetoric is a sign of his desperation. He didn’t even mention Trump’s recent conviction on 34 felonies in his summary of Trump’s long losing streak! Trump’s best day was in November, 2016, Swalwell said, meaning the day Trump won the 2016 presidential election. “He has been a serial loser since.” Swalwell counted the ways: “He lost the House in 2018. He lost the White House and the Senate [in 2020]. We kept the House in 2020. In 2022, that big red wave that was supposed to come did not come. In fact, we added a seat in the Senate.” On top of that, most of Trump’s endorsements failed last year, Swalwell noted. He cited Democratic victories in Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia. Trump is “on a losing streak, so he’s choosing violence,” Swalwell added. “And that's what this upcoming election is very much going to be about,” Swalwell continued. “Who do we prefer? A person of character or a person who has felony convictions but lacks any moral conviction?” Swalwell on Trump: "His best day was in November of 2016, and he has been a serial loser since ... he doesn't have the votes, so he's choosing violence." [pic.twitter.com/5P0g3CAMA3] — Aaron Rupar (@atrupar) [June 13, 2024]

author: TELEMUNDO 47
title: ¡Se acaba el tiempo! Amtrak ofrece 30% de descuento para viajes a NYC, Boston, Washington, Filadelfia y más
text:
NUEVA YORK — Si tienes planes de viajar a alguna ciudad del noreste de Estados Unidos este invierno, te tenemos buenas noticias.
Esto porque Amtrak está ofreciendo un descuento de hasta el 30% para aquellos que quieran viajar en tren a Nueva York, Boston, Filadelfia, Washington, D.C. y otros destinos intermedios.
Las personas tienen hasta este viernes 24 de enero para comprar sus pasajes con descuento para reservar viajes entre el 1 de febrero hasta el 31 de marzo.

author: world today news
title: Benito Juárez 2024 Scholarship Payments: Schedule by Last Name
text:
Benito Juárez Scholarship Payments Begin in December Mexican students ‍receiving ⁣the Benito ⁢juárez scholarship can expect their payments to begin rolling out in early December. The program,designed to ⁣support ⁣students from ‌low-income families,has released a detailed payment schedule⁢ outlining ‍the disbursement‌ dates based on the first letter of recipients’ last names. December Payment Schedule December 2, Monday: A December 3,⁤ Tuesday: B December 4, Wednesday: C December 5, ⁤Thursday: D, E, F December 6, Friday: G December 9, Monday:​ H, I, ‌J, K December 10, ⁢Tuesday:‍ L December 11, Wednesday: M December 13,⁤ Friday: N, Ñ, O december 16, Monday: P, Q December 18, Wednesday: R December 19 and ‍20, Thursday and ⁢Friday: S december 23, Monday: T, U, V, W,⁤ X, Y, Z Checking Your Payment Status Students can ⁣easily verify the status⁢ of their ⁣Benito Juárez scholarship ‍payment online. The⁣ program’s official website⁤ provides a dedicated portal for this purpose. Visit the official‌ website at⁢ My Benito Juárez Scholarship . Enter your CURP (Clave ⁤Única de Registro de Población) in the designated field. If you don’t ⁣know your‍ CURP, the portal offers a ⁣tool to⁢ help you find it. Check the “I’m not a robot”‍ box and click “Search.” Once logged in,‍ you’ll be able to view: The current status of your⁢ scholarship. Details about the ‍specific program you are enrolled in. Details regarding your family⁣ group. Your beneficiary type. A ⁣groundbreaking discovery in the field of archaeology ​has ⁣unearthed a trove of ancient artifacts in the heart of Egypt, shedding new light⁤ on the lives and customs ​of a⁢ long-lost civilization. The‍ excavation, lead by a team of international researchers, has yielded an ‌astonishing array⁢ of objects, including intricately carved statues, pottery adorned with vibrant murals,‍ and tools that offer a glimpse into the daily routines of these​ ancient‍ people.
“This discovery is truly remarkable,” said Dr.‌ Emily ​Carter, the lead archaeologist on the ‌project. “These artifacts provide invaluable insights into‍ the culture, beliefs, and technological advancements ​of this ancient society. We are ​only beginning to scratch ‍the‌ surface of what this site has to offer.”
Among the most striking finds​ is a series​ of intricately⁢ carved ⁣statues depicting figures in ⁣elaborate attire. Experts beleive these statues may represent deities or important members of the community. The pottery unearthed at the⁣ site is equally remarkable, featuring vibrant‌ murals that depict⁣ scenes‍ of daily life, religious ceremonies, and mythical creatures.
“The level ⁤of detail and artistry in these artifacts is truly⁣ astounding,” remarked​ Dr.ahmed Hassan, a ​renowned egyptologist⁢ who⁢ is ‍collaborating​ on the project. “These ‍objects ⁣offer‍ a rare and precious window into the past, ⁤allowing us to connect with the lives and ⁣experiences of⁣ people who lived thousands of ‌years ago.”
the ‍excavation is ongoing, and researchers are⁢ hopeful that further discoveries will continue to unveil the secrets of this ancient civilization. The artifacts recovered from the ‌site will be carefully studied and preserved, ensuring that these invaluable‍ pieces of history are available for future generations to learn from and appreciate.
The‍ discovery has generated notable excitement within the archaeological⁢ community and beyond. It serves as a powerful reminder of the rich history and cultural heritage​ that⁣ lies buried beneath the⁢ sands of time, waiting to be uncovered and shared with​ the world.
## Expert Interview: ⁤Benito Juarez ​Scholarship Payments Begin in‍ December
**World Today News:** The Benito ‌Juarez Scholarship program is set to‍ begin ‌distributing payments in early December. We’re joined today by Dr.Maria Lopez, ‌a leading ⁤expert on educational equity‍ in Mexico, to⁢ shed some light ⁢on the ⁤program’s impact and what students can expect. Welcome,Dr. Lopez.
**dr. Lopez:** Thank you for having me.
**World Today News:** Dr. Lopez, can you tell us ⁢a bit about the significance of the Benito Juarez Scholarship program?
**Dr. Lopez:** This program is transformative‌ for low-income students in Mexico. ‍It provides direct financial assistance, covering tuition fees, books, and other⁣ educational expenses.This allows young people from ⁢disadvantaged backgrounds ⁣to pursue higher education without the burden of crippling debt. ⁢It’s a vital tool for promoting social mobility and creating a more equitable society.
**World Today News:**⁤ The program has released a detailed payment schedule for december. Can​ you walk us ​through ⁢the key‌ points?
**Dr. Lopez:** Absolutely. Payments will be deposited in a‍ phased manner, ‌starting December 2nd and continuing throughout the month. ⁣The disbursement dates are organized ⁣alphabetically based on​ the ⁢first letter of students’ last ‍names. This ensures a structured and efficient ‍process. The full schedule is available on the official Benito Juarez scholarship website.
**World Today News:** that’s helpful facts for students eagerly awaiting their funds. ‌ How can students confirm their‍ payment status?
**Dr. Lopez:** It’s very straightforward.Students can⁢ check the status of their payments through the program’s online portal. They’ll need their CURP (Clave Única de ⁣registro ⁣de Población). The portal⁢ walks them through the process, and even ‌provides a ⁣tool ⁣to ⁣help locate their CURP if they’re unsure of‌ it.
**World ⁢Today News:** What ‌advice ⁣would‌ you⁢ give to students who are new to the program?
**Dr. Lopez:** Firstly, familiarize yourself with the payment schedule and the online portal. Keep all your⁣ documentation ⁣readily available,​ including your CURP and any interaction‍ from ‌the program. If you face any issues, don’t hesitate to contact the ⁣program’s support team. They are ‍there ⁣to assist you.
**World‌ Today News: ** We appreciate your valuable insights, Dr. Lopez. Thank you for sharing your expertise ‍with our readers.
**Dr.‌ Lopez:** It’s my pleasure.
**World today ⁢News:** And to our ‍readers, we ⁣hope this information proves helpful. remember to check the official Benito Juarez Scholarship website for⁣ the most ‍up-to-date ‌information and support.

author: Ambar Warrick
title: Boeing workers to go on strike as union rejects labor deal By Investing.com
text:
Investing.com-- More than 30,000 Boeing Co (NYSE: BA ) workers will go on strike from Friday after the company’s West Coast factory workers voted to strike over demands for higher pay, presenting more challenges for the planemaker.
The strike is set to commence from midnight, Pacific time (0700 GMT), and is the company’s first major strike since 2008. Reports from local media outlets in Washington showed 96% of workers voted in favor of the strike, with workers stating that the pay and benefits offered by the company in recent negotiations were insubstantial to live on.
The strike represents another major headwind for the planemaker, which is struggling to restore its reputation in the wake of more quality issues with its crafts. Scrutiny of Boeing was rekindled this year after a door panel blew off a 737 MAX jet in January, while a failure in the company’s Starliner spacecraft stranded two astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
Friday's strike represents another major challenge for new Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg, who was appointed in August to help restore the legacy planemaker's reputation.
Boeing’s last strike, in 2008, had cost the company roughly $1.3 billion in staggered production and higher wages.
Boeing workers to go on strike as union rejects labor deal
